description.summary: This cluster encompasses senior-level marketing professionals who hold titles such as Vice President, Director, and Managing Director. They are responsible for overseeing comprehensive marketing strategies, managing large teams, and driving brand growth through strategic planning and execution. Their roles often involve cross-functional collaboration, budget management, and the implementation of integrated marketing campaigns.
commonCharacteristics: Senior leadership roles in marketing departments
Responsible for strategic planning and brand development
description.typicalBackground: Professionals in this cluster typically have extensive experience in various marketing roles, progressing from managerial positions to executive leadership. They often possess strong backgrounds in strategic planning, communications, and brand management, with proven track records of driving successful marketing campaigns and initiatives.

matchReasons: Holds the title of Vice President at FleishmanHillard
Responsible for managing national media and marketing campaigns
Possesses skills in Strategic Planning, Team Leadership, and Marketing Strategy
Serves as Vice President of Marketing at Community Choice Credit Union
Oversees marketing and business development
Experienced in Marketing Communications and Strategic Planning
AVP Marketing Engagement and Communications at Community Choice Credit Union
Leads marketing strategies and communications
Skilled in Strategic Planning and Team Leadership

description.summary: Individuals in this cluster specialize in organizing, coordinating, and executing events. Their roles include managing all aspects of event production, from planning and logistics to on-site execution and post-event analysis. They work closely with clients, vendors, and internal teams to ensure successful and seamless event experiences.
commonCharacteristics: Hands-on roles in event planning and execution
Experience with vendor management and on-site coordination
description.typicalBackground: Professionals in this cluster often start in entry-level event coordination roles and advance to production and management positions. They possess strong backgrounds in event management, logistics, and production, with the ability to handle high-pressure situations and ensure flawless event execution.

matchReasons: Holds the title of Experiential Production Coordinator at Lincoln Center
Responsible for organizing and executing events
Skilled in Event Planning and Production Coordination
Title as Event Producer at Creative Riff
Responsible for organizing and executing various events
Expertise in Event Planning and Production Management
Role as Partner at Outerkind focusing on event production
Responsible for executing high-profile events
Experienced in Event Management and Production Planning

description.summary: This cluster includes professionals focused on managing client accounts, ensuring client satisfaction, and driving business growth through effective account strategies. They act as the primary point of contact between the agency and clients, orchestrating resources to meet client needs and deliver successful outcomes.
commonCharacteristics: Client-facing roles with responsibility for account growth
Experience in managing multiple client accounts simultaneously
description.typicalBackground: Account Management Specialists typically have backgrounds in sales, marketing, or communications. They progress from account coordinators to account directors and managers, developing expertise in client relations, strategic account planning, and cross-functional team coordination to deliver client-focused solutions.

matchReasons: Current role as Field Marketing Manager at Portillo's Hot Dogs
Responsible for managing marketing needs and client relationships
Skilled in Client Relationship Management and Project Coordination
Role as Vice President of Marketing at Community Choice Credit Union
Oversees marketing strategies and client engagement
Experienced in Account Strategy and Strategic Planning
Position as Account Supervisor at The Food Group
Manages multiple client accounts and ensures satisfaction
Expertise in Communication and Account Strategy

description.summary: Professionals in this cluster are responsible for the creation and management of creative content and production activities. They work on developing content strategies, overseeing creative teams, and ensuring that all creative outputs align with brand objectives and campaign goals. Their roles often bridge the gap between creative ideation and production execution.
commonCharacteristics: Roles focused on content creation and creative strategy
Strong backgrounds in creative fields such as design, writing, or content production
Experience managing creative teams and content projects
description.typicalBackground: Creative Production and Content Professionals often have backgrounds in design, media, communications, or related fields. They progress from creative roles to leadership positions, developing expertise in creative strategy, content management, and cross-functional collaboration to deliver compelling and effective creative content.

Responsible for creative branding and art direction
